articles.author: ELENA BECATOROS
articles.description: BARI, Italy (AP) — Leaders of the Group of Seven leading industrialized nations are turning their attention to migration on the second day of their summit Friday, seeking ways to combat trafficking and increase investment in countries from where migrants start out on often life-threatening journeys.
articles.title: G7 leaders tackle the issue of migration on the second day of their summit in Italy

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD and KELVIN CHAN
articles.description: BARI, Italy (AP) — Pope Francis is no stranger to artificial intelligence — a deepfake photo of him in a white puffer jacket went viral last year — but his concerns about AI go far beyond an unflattering shot and are now taking center stage at the Group of Seven summit.
articles.title: Pope Francis will be the first pontiff to address a G7 venue. He's raising the alarm about AI

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER and EDITH M. LEDERER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S.-built pier to bring food to Gaza is facing one of its most serious challenges yet — its humanitarian partner is deciding if it's safe to keep delivering supplies arriving by sea to starving Palestinians.
articles.title: The US pier in Gaza is facing its latest challenge — whether the UN will keep delivering the aid

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: MINA, Saudi Arabia (AP) — In sweltering temperatures, Muslim pilgrims in Mecca converged on a vast tent camp in the desert on Friday, officially opening the annual Hajj pilgrimage. Ahead of their trip, they circled the cube-shaped Kaaba in the Grand Mosque, Islam’s holiest site.
articles.title: Muslims start the Hajj against the backdrop of the destructive Israel-Hamas war

articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court unanimously upheld access to a drug used in the majority of U.S.
articles.title: Takeaways from Supreme Court ruling: Abortion pill still available but opponents say fight not over

articles.author: JAMEY KEATEN
articles.description: GENEVA (AP) — Switzerland will host scores of world leaders this weekend to try to map out first steps toward peace in Ukraine even though Russia, which launched and is continuing the war, won’t take part.
articles.title: A peace summit for Ukraine opens in Switzerland, but Russia won't be taking part

articles.author: TERRY SPENCER
articles.description: PARKLAND, Fla. (AP) — A crew is scheduled Friday to begin tearing down the three-story classroom building where 17 people died in the 2018 mass shooting at Parkland's Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.
articles.title: Demolition of the Parkland classroom building where 17 died in 2018 shooting is set to begin

articles.author: FREIDA FRISARO, TERRY SPENCER and DANIEL KOZIN
articles.description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) — Forecasters warned Floridians to prepare for additional flash flooding after a tropical disturbance dumped as much as 20 inches (50 centimeters) of rainfall in the southern parts of the state, with worsening conditions expected Friday.
articles.title: Florida prepares for next round of rainfall after tropical storms swamped southern part of the state

articles.author: TOM KRISHER and DAVID HAMILTON
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Tesla shareholders voted Thursday to restore CEO Elon Musk's record $44.9 billion pay package that was thrown out by a Delaware judge earlier this year, sending a strong vote of confidence in his leadership of the electric vehicle maker.
articles.title: Elon Musk wins back his $44.9 billion Tesla pay package in shareholder vote

articles.author: R.J. RICO and JESSE BEDAYN
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — In a dreary part of downtown Atlanta, shipping containers have been transformed into an oasis for dozens of previously unsheltered people who now proudly call a former parking lot home.
articles.title: Micro communities for the homeless sprout in US cities eager for small, quick and cheap solutions
